author: Kunal Kumrawat
title: India Women's National Ice Hockey Team Needs 'You'
text:
The India women's national ice hockey team represents India internationally at various international level Ice Hockey events. 
Every great sport, take cricket, for instance, has always suffered at the initial level to fight for the place in India and at the global platforms as well. In the same way, the Indian women's ice hockey team remains an 'underdog' even after representing India at the IIHF Women's Challenge Cup Of Asia Division 2016 . 
Even, many in the country are not aware of the fact that this team exists. The problem Indian women's ice hockey team is facing isn't new. Let's have a look at their story. India Women's National Ice Hockey Team Needs 'You' 754 396 via 
A group of few people visited Ladakh to enjoy the -20 to -35 Â° Celsius of temperature there. And let me tell you, it's unbearable. While they were still on their exploration near Himalayas mountain range, which was a frozen lake at Gupuks, Leh, they discovered a bunch of women skating on the ice, holding sticks in their hand. It made them wonder in shock, and that's when the unknown story of these women was discovered. The unconventional sport. 
These women were passionate and dedicated themselves entirely to the 'other' hockey that's played on ice. They loved this unconventional sport so much that they chose not to give up, no matter what comes ahead of them. While the world believed it's just a local thing, they dreamed of taking it to another level. via 
In 2016, the team participated in an international competition in Chinese Taipei. In their opening game of the contest, team India lost (1 - 8) to Singapore. The team had also lost other three major matches at the group stage, including their biggest defeat against Chinese Taipei of (0 - 13). However, there were some positives as well. 
Noor Jahan, Goal Tender for Indian Women's Ice Hockey Team was bestowed the best goaltender award by the media. In the midst of their defeats, we found some inspiring stories. via 
And an example for this could be, Stanzin Chotso. She was the youngest player on this team, and most probably in the whole tournament. She's amazingly talented! 
In 2016, when the team was going for the tournament in Chinese Taipei, this 17-year-old young lady was meant to appear in her 10th standard board examinations. Stanzin chose to follow her passion, and it was to go with her team as one of the most crucial players.
